title: I Love It When Cassian‚Äôs Blaster Does the Thing
description: A love letter to a small noise in a big Star Wars show.
full_text:
There is a lot to love in¬†Andor. It is a dense show, a big show, one that is filled with fascinatingly layered characters worth diving deep into, twisting plotlines that hold a mirror up to our world and the galaxy far, far away alike. It‚Äôs a show that, in spite of a certain reputation in contrast to other¬†Star Wars stories, is filled with little nods to the franchise‚Äôs history old and new. But right now, at least in our moment of interest, it‚Äôs a show where Cassian Andor‚Äôs blaster pistol goes¬†vuh-weeeeee. Just like¬†Andor more broadly, there‚Äôs also a lot to love about Cassian‚Äôs blaster pistol. It‚Äôs a MW-20 Bryar pistol, itself one of those aforementioned little nods: the design is heavily inspired by the legendary K-16 Bryar pistol wielded by Kyle Katarn in the Star Wars video game series¬†Dark Forces, a character with intriguing parallels to Cassian even beyond the latter in part subsuming the role of the former in modern continuity.

 It‚Äôs a good-looking gun design even beyond that legacy, just a flat wedge of weaponry with a handle attached‚Äîdifferent enough to Han‚Äôs iconic DL-44 but in that sort of vein, that excellent Star Wars mix of looking just askance to a real-world gun but with a greebled, sci-fi layer. It also does a little flippy-thing with the body of the blaster that‚Äôs very cool, which brings us to that sound. The vuh-weeeeee¬†is what accompanies that spinning of main section of the blaster, and in a franchise just bursting with incredible sound design, it‚Äôs maybe one of¬†Andor‚Äòs best additions to the auditory canon. It‚Äôs subtle, but pointed, a layer of Cassian‚Äôs intimidation whenever he pulls the pistol out to point at someone. Star Wars guns don‚Äôt need cocking or reloading like some actual weapons do; a blaster bolt is superheated gas condensed into a shard of pure energy. Maybe that‚Äôs the gas being primed, maybe the chamber is re-filling the flow of tibanna ready to be charged up and fired. Honestly I don‚Äôt really care to know, because while the internal mechanics of a MW-20 Bryar blaster pistol might be cool, but they‚Äôre kind of not the point. ¬© Lucasfilm The vuh-weeeeee¬†serves as a similar auditory clue to both the audience and the characters around Cassian that he‚Äôs ready to pop off at a moment‚Äôs notice. There‚Äôs an actual mechanical ka-chunk noise too, presumably of that spinning section locking back into place on the blaster, but it‚Äôs the¬†vuh-weeeeee that really sticks in your ear, this high-pitched little whine. In¬†Andor Cassian is the kind of man who rarely pulls out a blaster pistol to not use it: from Skeen to Cloris, when the bryar‚Äôs broken out, he means business. You hear that¬†ka-chunk, as it settles into a vuh-weeeeee, and you know Cassian‚Äôs good to go, and that somebody‚Äôs probably about to get a bolt put through them.

 This high strung, intense little noise is not unlike the wielder of the weapon that makes it. After all, what is Cassian Andor if not a primed bolt of pure energy, ready to go off at a moment‚Äôs notice, ready to be aimed in the direction of something and fired at it for maximum effect? All it takes is a ka-chunk, then a¬†vuh-weeeeee, and he‚Äôs ready to burn a hole through the structures of power he‚Äôs rebelling against. Perhaps all that‚Äôs true. But maybe it‚Äôs also just true that vuh-weeeeee sounds cool as hell, and in a show already bursting with so many ideas and details, at the end of the day, you also just need a bunch of cool spacey noises.¬†Andor is all that character work, all that symbolism and commentary, but it‚Äôs also the vuh-weeeeee. And it wouldn‚Äôt quite be¬†Star Wars if it wasn‚Äôt both.  Want more io9 news? Check out when to expect the latest Marvel, Star Wars, and Star Trek releases, what‚Äôs next for the DC Universe on film and TV, and everything you need to know about the future of Doctor Who.

title: 10 Underrated ATEEZ Songs That Every K-Pop Fan Should Appreciate
description: ATEEZ is known for their powerful sound and stage presence, but some of their music continues to be criminally underrated, even in the K-Pop realm.
full_text:
ATEEZ is an eight-member K-Pop boy group under KQ Entertainment that is here to stay. Their music is flashy, and their performances are impeccable, bringing a consistent level of stage presence and energy that most groups can only dream of.    Their debut mini-album from 2018 is nothing to laugh at, but it serves as an impressive jumping-off point for where their soon-to-be signature style would go shortly after. ATEEZ's chemistry as a group shines in everything they do. That, combined with their well-known ability to command every stage they step foot on, has already led them to become the first K-Pop boy group to perform at Coachella in 2024 and the first K-Pop artist to perform at Morocco's Mawazine music festival that same year.    Their music speaks for itself, but a large portion of their discography feels incredibly underrated. The songs listed below are just 10 that I feel deserve much more appreciation among ATEEZ fans and K-Pop fans in general - and among those who simply enjoy good pop music.    
            10 
        
                            DEEP DIVE
                    
       
            GOLDEN HOUR : Part.2 (2024)
    

    
    
    
Many of the songs on this list were, at the time of release, overshadowed by more popular tracks. "DEEP DIVE" had to compete with the effortlessly cool title track "Ice On My Teeth" and "Selfish Waltz," another synth-pop track to add to their collection that is arguably one of their best songs, so it's no wonder it got swept under the rug. With its haunting lyrics about growing accustomed to loneliness and references to actual events, particularly in the rap verses, "DEEP DIVE" immediately stands out to me as one of the group's most honest songs    
                        The higher I go, the thinner the air gets    
                    Like altitude sickness, even my companions fade away    
                    A cold space where I face my inn–µr self    
                    I‚Äôm smiling, but why does it look like I‚Äôm crying?    
                    Lik–µ shoddy construction, the lies I‚Äôve built up, when will they crumble?    
                    Hiding my anxiety, I hold my breath    
            Rapper Mingi delivers what might be my favorite of his verses in a long time, directly calling out the anxiety that forced him to take a hiatus in 2020, while Hongjoong acknowledges his crammed schedule that included attending two fashion shows in Paris directly after the first leg of their most recent world tour. I'm a sucker for lyrics, and this song checks all the boxes.    
            9 
        
                            THANXX
                    
       
            ZERO : FEVER Part.1 (2020)
    

    
    
    
"THANXX" is the only title track on this list. While reviewing the group's catalog, there were certain title tracks that felt more widely recognized than others, but none felt more underrated than this. Like most music that was released in 2020, unfortunate timing could have something to do with its wider reception. ZERO : FEVER Part.1 is a great collection of seven tracks that couldn't have been led by a more appropriate song.

			10 Essential K-Pop Albums Every Fan Should Listen To
		
	

                                                    
                									Whether you're just getting into the genre or are a lifelong fan, these 10 essential albums are sure to deepen your love of K-Pop music.
			

                    


                
                
                
                

                
                
                
                	


                

                
                
                
            
                
        
        
        
            
The group was just starting to find their footing, and "THANXX" sees them question the authority that looms over their every move. It's a song that feels almost cocky in its delivery, something that I think ATEEZ does perfectly but not nearly enough. They detest common phrases like "Back in my day" and "You'll know when you get a little older" with youthful authenticity that lets listeners know right away they're a group who do things their own way.    
            8 
        
                            Celebrate
                    
       
            ZERO : FEVER Part.2 (2021)
    

    
    
    
You'll notice from this list alone that ATEEZ is capable of sounding right at home in several different sounds. "Celebrate" is a B-side that accompanies the title track "Fireworks (I'm The One)," a steamy, powerful song whose music video alone could distract just about anyone from the rest of the mini-album that, in my opinion, houses some of their best songs.    



        
            ATEEZ is capable of sounding right at home in several different sounds.
    
        
    The lyrics to "Celebrate" encourage anyone listening to celebrate the little things in life, including the things that make each one of us different. Every time they sing "Congratulations for being born as you are" in the chorus, I feel like I'm receiving the most motivational pep talk I could ever hope for. It's the type of song that's perfect to start your day with, and the music video is enough to put a smile on your face.    
            7 
        
                            WE KNOW
                    
       
            THE WORLD EP.FIN : WILL (2023)
    

    
    
    
"WE KNOW" off of their latest full-length album, THE WORLD EP.FIN : WILL, is another that couldn't help but fade to the background among a track list that includes "Crazy Form," "ARRIBA," and four jaw-dropping subunit tracks that include a solo ballad by Jongho that gives me goosebumps every time he opens his mouth. This track feels perfect on the album that concludes their dystopian THE WORLD trilogy.    It could easily be found on the same album as "Guerrilla," filling out the unique atmosphere they've created within their albums that is worthy of its own feature film. Sirens permeate the background to make you feel like you're the one running for your life. The rap verses raise the stakes until the bridge brings everything in closer, only to burst at the seams in the final chorus.    
            6 
        
                            Siren
                    
       
            GOLDEN HOUR : Part.1 (2024)
    

    
    
    
ATEEZ welcomed in a new era in 2024, shortly after their performances at Coachella. "WORK" introduced an entirely new sound, and its B-sides did much of the same. So far, their GOLDEN HOUR mini-albums haven't been their most cohesive, but they've shown sides of the group that continue to impress and hypnotize fans with their innate ability to master any sound.

			5 K-Pop Acts Who Are Ready To Headline Coachella In 2026
		
	

                                                    
                									With the bar set so high by the women of BLACKPINK, these K-Pop acts are prepared to take on the challenge of headlining Coachella in 2026.
			

                    


                
                
                
                

                
                
                
                	


                

                
                
                
            
                
        
        
        
            
"Siren" is the track off of GOLDEN HOUR : Part.1 that felt the most familiar to me. It has the same dystopian feeling as songs like "Sector 1" or "Outlaw," the latter being another underrated song that almost made this list, while also welcoming in a raw power that elevates their previous releases. Mingi delivers another of my personal favorite verses of his, while the chanting chorus feels made to be performed in stadiums by their fans who have more than proved themselves capable of matching the group's energy.    
            5 
        
                            AURORA
                    
       
            TREASURE EP.3 : One To All (2019)
    

    
    
    
The group's 2019 mini-album, TREASURE EP.3 : One To All, was the one that saw them achieve their first music show win with "Wave," a song that is consistently appreciated by the members and played on every tour to constant excitement from the audience. I love "Wave" as much as the next person... well, maybe not as much. It's a fun, summery song that is understandably a favorite, but my loyalties lie with "AURORA."    



        
            ATEEZ doesn't have any other song like "AURORA."
    
        
    ATEEZ doesn't have any other song like "AURORA." Its dreamy instrumental builds to an even dreamier chorus accompanied by beautiful falsetto from the group's vocalists. Everything from the scaled-back vocal delivery to Hongjoong and Mingi's more gentle rap verses feel unique to just this one song, making it a spectacle with every listen and every viewing of its performance video that each K-Pop fan needs to hear at least once.    
            4 
        
                            TO THE BEAT
                    
       
            ZERO : FEVER Part.1 (2020)
    

    
    
    
Don't let the silly music video fool you. "TO THE BEAT" is one of ATEEZ's most confident songs that borders right on the line between confidence and cockiness, something I always appreciate in K-Pop from groups like BTS who know their worth and aren't afraid to let you know.    
                        Now the excitement is going up endlessly, everything exploded (Exploded)    
                    But why do you have a problem? Are you offended? (Sorry!)    
                    It‚Äôs the inferiority complex, we're already on another level    
                    No matter how much you try, we will win it all    
            I'm just now realizing that I've somehow included my three favorite Mingi rap verses on this list, and I'm not quite sure how that happened. If I had to pick a favorite, it'd definitely be his verse in "TO THE BEAT," especially when it's performed live, and you can visibly see his confidence grow as it goes on. Hongjoong's verse that starts the song drops you right into its energy, calling out those who try to copy them with unmerciful honesty. Overall, this song continues to be one of their strongest, and one I hope they emulate in a future release.    
            3 
        
                            WDIG (Where Do I Go)
                    
       
            THE WORLD EP.1 : MOVEMENT (2022)
    

    
    
    
"WDIG (Where Do I Go)" is a song that I didn't come to fully appreciate until sometime last year. It's another that was almost immediately brushed aside by both fans and ATEEZ in favor of its more well-known counterparts "Guerrilla," "Cyberpunk," and "New World." In all fairness, it never really stood a chance, but now it's one of my three favorites from this mini-album. It's also one that I feel like the only fan in the world of, so we need to change that.    



        
            This mini-album deserves to be appreciated for all of its tracks and the atmosphere they create.
    
        
    Out of the six songs from THE WORLD EP.1 : MOVEMENT, "WDIG (Where Do I Go)" is the only one that's never been performed live, which feels like a crime to a certain degree. Wooyoung, Jongho, and San's vocal delivery in the pre-choruses were what ultimately pulled me in. The quiet devastation in their voices juxtaposes with the song's overall gritty sound to provide a balance that never feels out of place. This mini-album deserves to be appreciated for all of its tracks and the atmosphere they create altogether.    
            2 
        
                            White Love
                    
       
            Season Songs (2021)
    

    
    
    
ATEEZ's most underrated project is Season Songs, a special mini-album of three tracks that each emulates the feeling of a different season or holiday. "Be My Lover" is the perfect song for spring and summer that features Kim Jong Kook. "The Black Cat Nero" is a K-Pop cover of an Italian children's song that was covered by Turbo, a duo featuring Kim Jong Kook, and then covered by ATEEZ with a new sound perfect for your Halloween playlist.

			10 K-Pop Artists You Need To See On Tour In 2025
		
	

                                                    
                									K-Pop is all about the performances, so why not find some time this year to see your favorite K-Pop artists on tour? Here are our recommendations.
			

                    


                
                
                
                

                
                
                
                	


                

                
                
                
            
                
        
        
        
            
"White Love" is the winter song on this album, a sweet song that invites you to compare love to pure white snow and promises to love you long after it's all melted. It features every member giving their most gorgeous vocal delivery with the shimmering chorus and Jongho's voice being the cherry on top of the sweetest cake you'll ever eat.    
            1 
        
                            Don't Stop
                    
       
            Don't Stop Single Album (2022)
    

    
    
    
To my knowledge, there are some ATEEZ fans who don't even know this song exists. "Don't Stop" was a special single released through UNIVERSE Music, an original music content project that released songs from artists like THE BOYZ, MONSTA X, and Kep1er. In January 2023, all the singles released through this company disappeared, leaving fans in shambles until they were re-uploaded weeks later.    As soon as I watched the "Don't Stop" music video for the first time, it became my favorite video of theirs. The video doesn't feature any choreography, just clips of the members that connect to form their most cohesive plot yet. It's a loud song that transitions between more grating instrumentals and a piano-driven sound in the second verse. I don't think they have many songs like this, and they for sure don't have any music videos like it. If you get nothing else out of this, I hope you get to hear ATEEZ's "Don't Stop" for the first time.    ‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

title: K-Pop‚Äôs Live Boom 2025: SEVENTEEN‚Äôs Record Gross, A Promising 2nd Half
description: K-pop‚Äôs record-breaking midyear tour grosses, agency revenue shifts, and acts like TWICE, ATEEZ and ENHYPEN gearing up for a blockbuster second half of 2025.
full_text:
Joshua Hong, Mingyu, The8, Seungkwan, Hoshi, Wonwoo, Dino, S.Coups, Woozi, Vernon of Seventeen ... More performs at the 2024 Billboard Music Awards. (Photo by Christopher Polk/Penske Media via Getty Images)Penske Media via Getty Images
K-pop‚Äôs global momentum isn‚Äôt just confined to chart-topping hits and massive album sales this year: it‚Äôs on full display under the bright lights of arenas and stadiums worldwide with new milestones hit by the likes of SEVENTEEN, Stray Kids, BTS‚Äô j-hope, TVXQ!, BABYMONSTER and more.


Following the latest reports on midyear tour figures, the K-pop industry‚Äôs touring business has surpassed previous milestones with entertainment agencies leaning more heavily on live-performance revenue as we near the second half of 2025. It marks an apparent shift in K-pop, transitioning from being dependent on album sales to concert-fueled growth, with the trend unlikely to swing back as the rest of the year promises more prominent shows on the way.

SEVENTEEN Lead K-Pop‚Äôs Midyear Tour Report
Billboard‚Äôs midyear Boxscore report revealed that SEVENTEEN firmly established themselves as a world-class live act. Based on the reported touring data from October 1, 2024 through March 31, 2025, the boy band earned a staggering $120.9 million in gross revenue with 842,000 tickets sold during the period. Before celebrating their 10th anniversary in May, the stars secured the Number 3 spot on Billboard Boxscore‚Äôs all-genre midyear list ‚Äî only slightly behind Coldplay and Shakira, who are on massive stadium tours of their own with that have grossed a respective $142.1 million and $130 million. Remarkably, SEVENTEEN essentially doubled its midyear gross for the second consecutive year, jumping from $30 million in 2023 to $67.5 million in 2024.


SEVENTEEN‚Äôs third-place finish marks the highest ranking ever achieved by a Korean act in Billboard Boxscore‚Äôs midyear tally, surpassing BTS‚Äô previous Number 4 midyear placement from 2022.

But SEVENTEEN wasn‚Äôt the lone live phenomenon. Five K-pop acts made the all-genre Top 50 ranking for Billboard Boxscore, up from three in 2023 and two in 2022.
Fellow boy band ATEEZ, as well as j-hope of BTS, follow SEVENTEEN with $28.4 million and $28.1 million grossed, respectively, with j-hope noted as the first K-pop soloist ever to land on the midyear overall Top Tours chart. Rounding out this top five are ENHYPEN and TOMORROW X TOGETHER, grossing $25.6 million and $25.1 million, respectively.
MORE FOR YOU

Overall, K-pop acts on the midyear Top Tours chart generated $228 million while selling 1.6 million tickets from 78 reported shows. Billboard reports that the scene‚Äôs 2025 showing is a 79% increase over the 2024 total, which had already jumped 93% from 2023. In just two years‚Äô time, K-pop‚Äôs presence on the midyear Boxscore has more than tripled.
Many K-Pop Labels Pivot to Live Amid Rising RevenueAll artists appear for SMTOWN Live 2025 in Los Angeles, CaliforniaPress/Photo Courtesy of SM Entertainment

These touring triumphs highlight a strategic pivot among South Korea‚Äôs entertainment giants.
As the industry‚Äôs reliably massive album sales have softened, live performances have become the primary driver of growth. Major players, including HYBE, SM Entertainment, and YG Entertainment, reported first-quarter revenue surges, primarily driven by concert earnings.


Check out a breakdown of the year-over-year first-quarter numbers for each of the ‚Äúbig four‚Äù Korean-pop agencies below, with data provided by The Chosun Daily.

 HYBE: Recording an overall 38.7% revenue spike to $365 million, concert revenue soared 252% to $112.4 million, overtaking music sales (which declined 5.9%). Concerts now account for 31% of total revenue, compared to 12% a year earlier. J-Hope helped the company crank a milestone in the U.S. as the first K-pop soloist to perform a stateside stadium with his April 4 and 6 shows at BMO Stadium that grossed $8.8 million from brought in 42,800 attendees for ticket prices ranging from $59.50 to $279.50.
  
   HYBE‚Äôs 2024 and 2025 tour revenue included shows by SEVENTEEN, BTS‚Äô j-hope, ENHYPEN, TOMORROW X TOGETHER, LE SSERAFIM, BOYNEXTDOOR, &TEAM and more.
  
 SM Entertainment: Saw concert revenue climb 58% to $28.3 million, while album and digital sales still managed to rise 23% to $49.1 million.
  
   SM‚Äôs 2024 and 2025 tour revenue included shows by TVXQ!, Super Junior‚Äôs Yesung, Girls‚Äô Generation‚Äôs Taeyeon, SHINee‚Äôs Minho, NCT 127, NCT DREAM, NCT WISH, aespa and more. SM is also celebrating its 30th anniversary with its all-label SMTOWN Live concert across select cities around the world.
  
 YG Entertainment: Posted the biggest jump among the four with a 275% year-on-year increase in concert revenue, hitting $5.4 million.
  
   YG‚Äôs 2024 and 2025 tour revenue included shows by 2NE1, TREASURE, BABYMONSTER and more.
  
 JYP Entertainment: An outlier with a modest 3.1% revenue uptick to 140.8 billion won with a 41.6% drop in operating profit due to scaled-down tours and heavier investment in new debuts, the company‚Äôs concert revenue shrank by 26.5%, with concerts making up about 15% of the quarter‚Äôs revenue.
  
   JYP‚Äôs 2024 and 2025 tour revenue included shows by DAY6, NMIXX, Xdinary Heroes and more.
  

The Rest of 2025 Should Bring Bigger K-Pop Live NumberBang Chan, Lee Know, Changbin, Hyunjin, Han, Felix, Seungmin, and I.N. of Stray Kids perform at the ... More 2024 Billboard Music Awards. (Photo by JYP Entertainment/Penske Media via Getty Images)Penske Media via Getty Images
With still a month to go until July, the remainder of 2025 appears to be shaping up as a landmark period for further live and touring growth.
As further evidence, HYBE CEO Jason Jaesang Lee noted in a recent earnings call that the conglomerate has more than 150 concerts confirmed for 2025 from its artists, with additional announcements to follow. ‚ÄúBoth the scale and audience size will expand further in the second half,‚Äù Park said, per Chosun Daily.
Once again, peep the 2025 preview for the four major agencies.

 HYBE‚Äôs ongoing world tours as BTS members return: With mandatory military service completed in June for the remaining five members, BTS is reportedly expected to reconvene later this year, potentially fueling a major reunion tour. In the meantime, the eldest member, Jin, will embark on a world tour with dates across Asia, North America, and Europe this summer as j-hope closes out his ongoing solo trek. ENHYPEN‚Äôs Walk the Line world tour will wrap its Asia dates in June before setting off to the States and Europe, while LE SSERAFIM has teased North American dates for their Easy Crazy Hot Tour in September.
 SM books global festivals amid a mix of tours: aespa confirmed playing major international summer festivals like Morocco‚Äôs Mawazine and Tokyo‚Äôs Summer Sonic, with aespa also returning to Los Angeles for KCON 2025 LA with SHINee‚Äôs KEY, NCT 127 and RIIZE. Meanwhile, NCT DREAM and RIIZE will be on tour throughout the year, while some of the label‚Äôs soloists, like KAI of EXO, and units like Red Velvet‚Äôs Irene and Seulgi, will also hold concerts overseas. The company‚Äôs 30th anniversary celebration concert, SMTOWN Live, will also feature additional shows in 2025, following dates previous dates in Seoul, Mexico City, and Los Angeles.
 YG‚Äôs big BLACKPINK comeback: The label‚Äôs top earner is displaying its sustained drawing power with large amounts of tickets sold for stadium shows even as the group has yet to drop any new music. The label‚Äôs latest girl group, BABYMONSTER, will also continue its world tour with more U.S. dates after initially starting in New York and Los Angeles earlier this year.
 JYP plays its pair of aces: Both TWICE and Stray Kids have major tours in the pipeline. The girl group will mark their 10th anniversary with a full-length album and an expected tour. Meanwhile, Stray Kids will continue to build on their April momentum, which included a Number 3 spot on Billboard Boxscore‚Äôs April 2025 report, after grossing $35 million from six shows and attracting 313,000 attendees as part of the dominATE World Tour. SKZ‚Äôs two-night stand at Mexico City‚Äôs Estadio GNP Seguros (on April 26‚Äì27) alone pulled in $14.1 million from 110,000 tickets sold between $48.91‚Äì$225.16. Earlier in the month in S√£o Paulo, they also grossed $10.5 million from another 110,000 attendees, with tickets ranging from $40.16 to $160.64.

With unprecedented midyear grosses and Korean agencies realigning and diverting resources toward lucrative global tours, the K-pop industry‚Äôs blockbuster second half indicates its revenue mix is likely shifting even more toward live performances and, with that, setting new records around the world.

title: Lisa Joins Her Blackpink Bandmates With Her First Radio Smash
description: Lisa joins her Blackpink bandmates Jennie and Rose with her first hit on Billboard's Radio Songs chart, as "Priceless" with Maroon 5 debuts at No. 45 this week.
full_text:
Lisa joins her Blackpink bandmates Jennie and Rose with her first hit on Billboard's Radio Songs ... More chart, as "Priceless" with Maroon 5 debuts at No. 45 this week.   NEW YORK, NEW YORK - MAY 05: Lisa attends the 2025 Met Gala Celebrating "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style" at Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 05, 2025 in New York City.  (Photo by Theo Wargo/FilmMagic)FilmMagic
Lisa has enjoyed historic success on a handful of Billboard‚Äôs radio tallies as a soloist. A few tunes from her debut album released under her own alter ego have reached the pop lists in the past few months, but until this week, she had never managed to appear on the all-style, all-encompassing Radio Songs chart.


Thanks to her most recent collaboration, the Blackpink superstar finally lands on that list ‚Äî and with her arrival, she joins several of her bandmates in a historic showing.

Lisa Hits the Radio Songs Chart
Lisa earns her first hit on Billboard's Radio Songs chart this week alongside Maroon 5. The two musical acts launch "Priceless" at No. 45 on the 50-spot roster, which ranks the tracks that rack up the largest total number of audience impressions across all formats in the United States.


Lisa Joins Jennie and Ros√©
Lisa is just the third K-pop solo female musician to appear on the Radio Songs chart. She‚Äôs originally from Thailand, and not all of the music she‚Äôs created can be classified as K-pop, but she is usually associated with that style due to her years as a member of Blackpink.

The only two other solo women from that genre who have scored a hit on the Radio Songs tally are some of her Blackpink bandmates. Jennie became the first to do so when she joined The Weeknd and Lily-Rose Depp on ‚ÄúOne of the Girls.‚Äù That track spent just three frames on the Radio Songs chart and only climbed to No. 48.
MORE FOR YOU

Ros√© matched ‚Äì and then surpassed ‚Äì Jennie in this feat in late 2024 alongside Bruno Mars with ‚ÄúApt.‚Äù That catchy cut has skyrocketed to No. 4 in the 27 frames it has spent somewhere on the list. It still stands as the highest-rising hit ever by any K-pop musical artist. So far, only Blackpink singer Jisoo has missed out on this ranking.

"Priceless" Is Becoming a Radio Smash
"Priceless" is quickly becoming a true radio smash in America, as the cut has now spent three weeks on both the Pop Airplay and Adult Pop Airplay tallies. This frame, it lifts to Nos. 19 and 11, respectively, on those rosters. Just last time around, it debuted at No. 29 on the Adult Contemporary roster, and this week, it pushes forward one spot. In each instance, the poppy collaboration reaches a new high point.

title: Se ve como 'Spider-Man: un nuevo universo' pero va de idols coreanas matando demonios, y llegar√° a Netflix muy pronto
description: Si algo ha hecho bien Sony en los √∫ltimos a√±os en lo que al universo de Spider-Man se refiere son sin duda las pel√≠culas de animaci√≥n protagonizadas por Miles Morales como un alternativo trepamuros, las cuales nos sorprendieron a todos los que las vimos tanto‚Ä¶
full_text: De hecho, lo har√° en menos de un mes Las boys band ya no son lo que eran23/05/2025 13:10Si algo ha hecho bien Sony en los √∫ltimos a√±os en lo que al universo de Spider-Man se refiere son sin duda las pel√≠culas de animaci√≥n protagonizadas por Miles Morales como un alternativo trepamuros, las cuales nos sorprendieron a todos los que las vimos tanto por su historia, aunque lo del multiverso no sea lo m√°s original del mundo, como sobre todo por su fabulosa animaci√≥n.Es empezar a verla y saber que ah√≠ hay trabajo, tanto, que su t√©cnica se reaprovechar√° ahora para una cinta que estrenar√° Netflix en exclusiva en su plataforma y que cambiar√° de tercio completamente, aunque tambi√©n tendr√° mucha acci√≥n.Rivales a muerte, y con raz√≥nHablamos de Kpop Demon Hunters, una pel√≠cula de animaci√≥n que mezcla la est√©tica de Spider-Man: un nuevo universo y de su secuela con el universo del K-pop y una buena dosis de fantas√≠a sobrenatural.La historia se centra en Rumi, Mira y Zoey, tres superestrellas del K-pop que, cuando no est√°n llenando estadios con sus conciertos, se dedican a luchar en secreto contra demonios que amenazan con robar las almas de sus fans. Sin embargo, esta vez se enfrentan a una amenaza sin precedentes: una boy band rival que, en realidad, es un grupo de demonios camuflados dispuestos a conquistarlo todo gracias a su encanto diab√≥lico.Grandes nombresEl reparto de voces incluye a Arden Cho (Teen Wolf), May Hong (Tales of the City), Ji-young Yoo (Until Dawn), Ahn Hyo-seop, Byung Hun Lee (El juego del calamar), Daniel Dae Kim, Ken Jeong, Joel Kim Booster y Yunjin Kim. Adem√°s, las miembros de TWICE Jeongyeon, Jihyo y Chaeyoung tambi√©n participan poniendo voz a personajes y han grabado una canci√≥n original titulada Takedown, que suena en el tr√°iler.Ver en NetflixKpop Demon Hunters est√° dirigida por Maggie Kang (codirectora de Los Minions: El origen de Gru) y Chris Appelhans (El drag√≥n de los deseos), con guion coescrito junto a Danya Jimenez y Hannah McMechan (Gabby Duran: Alien total). La cinta est√° producida por Michelle Wong y respaldada por Sony Pictures Animation, el mismo estudio detr√°s de Spider-Man: un nuevo universo y Los Mitchell contra las m√°quinas.

title: NYC Exhibit Celebrates The Solo Artistry Of BTS Member Jimin
description: ‚ÄúThe Truth Untold,‚Äù an exhibit that celebrates the musical journey of BTS member Jimin, can be seen in New York City this June.
full_text:
The exhibit offers insight into Jimin's solo artistry.MMCL
‚ÄúThe Truth Untold,‚Äù an exhibit that celebrates the musical journey of BTS member Jimin, can be seen in New York City this June.

Jimin is a singer, songwriter and member of the world‚Äôs most popular k-pop band. He‚Äôs recognized globally for his many contributions to the band‚Äôs chart-topping hits, which include ‚ÄúButter,‚Äù ‚ÄúFake Love‚Äù and ‚ÄúPermission to Dance." Jimin not only adds his voice to the band‚Äôs distinctive sound, but with a background in modern dance he plays a prominent role in BTS‚Äô exceptional choreography. The personal and immersive exhibit documents Jimin‚Äôs journey as a solo artist.


His own solo discography includes ‚ÄúLie,‚Äù ‚ÄúSerendipity,‚Äù and ‚ÄúWith You,‚Äù which was on the soundtrack for the hit Korean TV series Our Blues. Jimi also recorded ‚ÄúVibe‚Äù in collaboration with k-pop icon Taeyang. Jimin‚Äôs first solo album ‚ÄúFace,‚Äù released in March 2023, made him the first South Korean solo artist to top the Billboard Hot 100.

‚ÄúThe Truth Untold" exhibition incorporates various installations, such as a large media wall and distortion mirrors, visually representing the album‚Äôs themes of introspection, confusion, and vulnerability.

(L-R) Jimin, Jungkook, RM, J-Hope, V, Jin, and SUGA of the k-pop band BTS visit the "Today" Show in ... More 2020. (Photo by Cindy Ord/WireImage)WireImage
Jimin‚Äôs second solo album ‚ÄúMuse‚Äù was released on July 19, 2024. ‚ÄúMuse‚Äù embodies Jimin‚Äôs journey to find the source of his inspiration. It features the main track, ‚ÄúWho,‚Äù a song that spent 44 weeks on Billboard‚Äôs Global 200. The exhibit‚Äôs vintage-style listening room evokes the aesthetic of his "Smeraldo Garden Marching Band (feat. Loco)" music, while video and diverse photo zones are designed to provide visitors with memorable, interactive encounters.
MORE FOR YOU

The exhibit features his handwritten production diaries and lyric notebooks, which offer insight into his creative process, as well as a curated display of his iconic fashion and props worn during various performances and music videos. There are trophies and awards that Jimin received for his solo work, plus recreations of music video sets from "Like Crazy" and ‚ÄúSet Me Free.‚Äù
The exhibit is organized by BigHit Music and Hybe, hosted by Paradise E&A and promoted by the global content agency MondayMorningCreativeLab (MMCL). ‚ÄúThe Truth Untold‚Äù will run from May 31 to June 29, 2025 at 30 Wall Street in New York City. The exhibit was previously displayed in Los Angeles.

title: 20 Most Iconic YouTube Videos of All Time
description: These 20 YouTube videos didn‚Äôt just go viral‚Äîthey *defined* the internet. From unexpected laughs to unforgettable dances, they prove that sometimes the most random moments make the biggest impact. Ready for a nostalgia trip? Let‚Äôs jump in!
full_text: YouTube isn‚Äôt just where you go to waste hours watching random stuff‚Äîit‚Äôs the birthplace of viral moments that have changed the internet forever.Since 2005, we‚Äôve witnessed everything from accidental genius to epic fails, and some of the weirdest, most random clips have become global sensations.Why do these videos matter? Because they show us that anyone can go viral‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs a toddler biting a finger, a confused dentist patient, or a dancing horse-riding guy in Seoul. These videos taught us that on the internet, all you need is the right moment (and maybe a little bit of luck).So, buckle up and let‚Äôs relive 20 videos that took over the world and made YouTube what it is today!1. ‚ÄúMe at the Zoo‚Äù (The First Ever YouTube Video)Why It‚Äôs Iconic: The very first video uploaded to YouTube, ‚ÄúMe at the Zoo,‚Äù features co-founder Jawed Karim standing in front of elephants at the San Diego Zoo. While it‚Äôs simple‚Äîjust a 19-second clip‚Äîit holds immense historical significance. This unassuming video marked the beginning of YouTube‚Äôs journey, a journey that would go on to revolutionize how we consume and share video content. 2. ‚ÄúCharlie Bit My Finger‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: Before YouTube became a hub for high-production content, ‚ÄúCharlie Bit My Finger‚Äù was one of the first viral family moments that captured the innocence of childhood. It‚Äôs a simple video of a toddler (Charlie) biting his older brother‚Äôs finger, and their hilarious interaction became one of the earliest viral hits. It‚Äôs relatable, pure, and captured that genuine family humor that made YouTube feel like a window into everyone‚Äôs everyday life. 3. ‚ÄúGangnam Style‚Äù by PsyWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: When Psy‚Äôs ‚ÄúGangnam Style‚Äù debuted, no one could predict that a K-pop song with a quirky dance would break the internet. It became the first video to surpass 1 billion views, redefining the potential for viral music videos. The ‚Äúhorse-riding‚Äù dance became a worldwide phenomenon, and even celebrities couldn‚Äôt resist taking part in the viral craze. Its infectious beat and choreography made it a cultural staple, even outside the K-pop genre. 4. ‚ÄúEvolution of Dance‚Äù by Judson LaipplyWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: ‚ÄúEvolution of Dance‚Äù is a perfect example of how YouTube could turn a simple idea into something universally loved. Judson Laipply‚Äôs ability to impersonate the dances of various decades, combined with his comedic timing, made this video a comedic masterpiece. It became the most-watched video on YouTube in its time and was one of the first videos to reach mass viral popularity before the platform became flooded with content. 5. ‚ÄúBaby Shark Dance‚Äù by PinkfongWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: Whether you love it or hate it, ‚ÄúBaby Shark‚Äù has made its mark. This catchy tune, with its simple dance moves, has become a favorite for children worldwide. Its viral success on YouTube catapulted it into the most-watched video of all time in 2020, surpassing even ‚ÄúDespacito.‚Äù The song is a cultural touchstone for kids, and it‚Äôs also a testament to the power of simple, repetitive, and highly engaging content. 6. ‚ÄúDavid After Dentist‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: This short, yet unforgettable video captures the post-dental surgery confusion of a young boy named David. His loopy, wide-eyed reactions to the anesthesia quickly became a source of endless memes and remixes. The rawness and sincerity of his confusion turned an everyday experience into one of the most widely-shared videos in internet history. 7. ‚ÄúSneezing Baby Panda‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: Panda videos are always adorable, but this one stands out because of the panda‚Äôs perfectly-timed sneeze. The look of surprise on its face made this video an immediate favorite, and the fact that it was so short and sweet made it perfect for repeat views. It embodies the viral power of animal clips and is one of the first to truly capture the viral essence of YouTube. 8. ‚ÄúThe Crazy Nastyass Honey Badger‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: This video turned a simple animal documentary into a full-blown comedic masterpiece. The narration, delivered with over-the-top attitude and humor, led to the now-famous ‚ÄúHoney Badger don‚Äôt care‚Äù catchphrase, which quickly became part of internet lexicon. It‚Äôs a perfect example of how YouTube allowed regular people to create viral content that could rival traditional media. 9. ‚ÄúRickroll‚Äù (Rick Astley ‚Äì ‚ÄúNever Gonna Give You Up‚Äù)Why It‚Äôs Iconic: The Rickroll is the ultimate internet prank, and it wouldn‚Äôt exist without the unexpected success of Rick Astley‚Äôs ‚ÄúNever Gonna Give You Up.‚Äù This music video, originally a 1980s hit, became a bait-and-switch meme, where unsuspecting viewers are lured into watching it under false pretenses. It‚Äôs a staple of internet culture and is still used as a joke today. 10. ‚ÄúLeave Britney Alone‚Äù by Chris CrockerWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: This emotional rant by Chris Crocker defending Britney Spears became one of YouTube‚Äôs first viral moments. It was raw, dramatic, and hilarious in its own way, leading to widespread parody, yet it also sparked a conversation about celebrity culture and internet bullying. Crocker‚Äôs over-the-top delivery turned a heartfelt plea into a viral sensation. 11. ‚ÄúNyan Cat‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: ‚ÄúNyan Cat‚Äù is pure internet whimsy: a cat with a pop-tart body flying through space while leaving a rainbow trail behind it. The absurdity and repetition made it both annoying and lovable, and it quickly became a meme that spread far beyond YouTube, featuring in remixes, parodies, and even video games. It‚Äôs an example of how a simple concept can become a cultural touchstone. 12. ‚ÄúWhat Does the Fox Say?‚Äù by YlvisWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: ‚ÄúWhat Does the Fox Say?‚Äù is an absurdly catchy song by the Norwegian comedy duo Ylvis. The outlandish lyrics, combined with a quirky music video, became an international phenomenon. The song‚Äôs comedic and nonsensical approach made it one of the most memorable viral hits in recent years. 13. ‚ÄúDouble Rainbow‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: The man‚Äôs emotional reaction to witnessing a double rainbow struck a chord with viewers. His over-the-top wonder and awe were both hilarious and heartwarming, making it one of the earliest examples of the ‚Äúwow‚Äù viral content that YouTube is known for. The phrase ‚ÄúWhat does it mean?‚Äù quickly entered the meme lexicon. 14. ‚ÄúShit Girls Say‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: A satirical take on the things women supposedly say, ‚ÄúShit Girls Say‚Äù became a viral sensation thanks to its clever humor and accurate observations about female speech. This video spawned countless parodies and led to a series of viral videos that highlighted quirky behaviors and stereotypes. 15. ‚ÄúDamn Daniel‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: The ‚ÄúDamn Daniel‚Äù video, featuring Daniel‚Äôs friends shouting ‚ÄúDamn Daniel!‚Äù in reaction to his white Vans, became a viral sensation due to its simplicity and catchphrase. The video became a meme and was featured in multiple TV appearances, cementing its place in viral video history. 16. ‚ÄúHarambe ‚Äì Dicks Out For Harambe‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: Harambe the gorilla‚Äôs death became the focus of a massive internet movement, leading to memes, merchandise, and even a movement calling for ‚ÄúDicks Out for Harambe.‚Äù The video has become emblematic of how the internet can turn a tragic event into a meme phenomenon that stays in the public consciousness for years. 17. ‚ÄúSalt Bae‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: Turkish chef Nusret G√∂k√ße, also known as Salt Bae, became an internet sensation after a video of him sprinkling salt in an extravagant fashion went viral. His dramatic gesture‚Äîflicking his fingers while salting food‚Äîbecame a meme and was widely parodied, showcasing how a small moment can go viral and become global. 18. ‚ÄúThe Dress‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: This viral debate over whether a dress was blue and black or white and gold captured the world‚Äôs attention and sparked intense debate across social media platforms. The dress became a symbol of how perception can vary, and it remains one of the most memorable viral moments in internet history. 19. ‚ÄúThe Ultimate Dog Tease‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: The ‚ÄúUltimate Dog Tease‚Äù video became a viral sensation thanks to its witty voiceover, which paired perfectly with a dog‚Äôs facial expressions, making it appear as if the dog was reacting to the conversation. It‚Äôs an early example of the humor that would dominate viral videos on the platform. 20. ‚ÄúKony 2012‚ÄùWhy It‚Äôs Iconic: The ‚ÄúKony 2012‚Äù campaign was a short film meant to raise awareness about Joseph Kony and the atrocities committed by the Lord‚Äôs Resistance Army in Uganda. Though the campaign sparked controversy, it became a massive viral sensation and is one of the most significant moments of YouTube‚Äôs potential for social impact. These videos represent the diversity of content that makes YouTube so special: from heartwarming family moments to laugh-out-loud viral hits, emotional pleas for celebrity support to humorous animal antics.They demonstrate how a single video, whether well-planned or totally spontaneous, can explode across the internet and become part of our shared cultural lexicon.YouTube, in all its unpredictable glory, continues to be a space where anyone‚Äôs content can go viral‚Äîmaking it a truly global stage for creativity and expression.Simon SterneSimon Sterne is a staff writer at WebdesignerDepot. He‚Äôs interested in technology, WordPress, and all things UX. In his spare time he enjoys photography.

title: HYBE, Home of BTS, Raided in Insider Trading Investigation
description: HYBE, home of BTS, has been raided as part of an insider trading investigation. The founder is separately under investigation for defrauding investors.
full_text:
HYBE, the management company behind BTS and other major K-pop acts, has been raided by prosecutors as part of an insider trading investigation.
According to The Korea Times, the Seoul Southern District Prosecutors‚Äô Office recently searched the company‚Äôs headquarters in central Seoul¬†over allegations of an executive using insider information to gain profits of $176,500 (240 million won).
This executive is being investigated after he allegedly purchased shares of fellow K-pop agency YG Entertainment‚Äôs subsidiary YG Plus after learning of HYBE‚Äôs investment plans in the company.
In January 2021, HYBE and its technology subsidiary, Weverse Company, acquired 17.89% of YG Plus in a merchandising and distribution deal.
Separately, Bang Si-hyuk, the founder and chairman of¬†HYBE, is under investigation over allegedly defrauding investors ahead of the company‚Äôs initial public offering in 2020 and pocketing $289 million (400 billion won).
In addition to BTS, HYBE is home to TXT, Seventeen,¬†LE SSERAFIM, and other K-pop stars.

title: A Customer Made An Insensitive Comment About Their Boss‚Äôs Music Choice, So This Person Put Him In His Place Using The Exact Same Words
description: If you can't say anything nice, just don't say anything at all.
full_text:
Pexels/Reddit
Some people think it‚Äôs okay to say offensive things to cultures they don‚Äôt understand.
This person was working in a bookstore during the busy holiday season.
Their boss was a big K-pop fan and would always play Korean pop songs in the store.
A customer walked in to trade books and made a rude comment about the music.
So, they quickly shut him down with the exact same words he said.
Read the full story below for all the details.

Well, thats weird.
This happened about a year ago, in the 2023 holiday season.
But I still think about it with glee.
So for background, I work in a bookstore.
And my boss at the time was really into K-pop, specifically BTS.
But she was branching out to try other Korean pop bands.
This person is not a fan of K-pop, but they tolerate their boss‚Äôs preference.
All in good fun, she often played new K-pop at the bookstore to try and get us into the scene.
None of the rest of us were quite fans.
But seeing her happy made us happy.
So we tolerated it day in, day out.
Don‚Äôt hate, there are good K-pop songs and bands.
They just aren‚Äôt our thing.
A male customer walked in to trade books.
So, as the holidays roll around, she put on K-pop Christmas music to test it out.
Then, a man walked in to trade books.
So, we started going through his books together.
Simple enough job, we are blowing through his boxes.
It was quick with how good we both are at this.
He asked about the music being played in the store.
We always invite customers to look around, so they don‚Äôt have to just wait.
I guess he wanted to just wait.
So, after about 3 minutes of just standing there and looking at us, he asks:
‚ÄúWhat music is this?‚Äù
He said the song was weird.
I glance at my boss for reassurance.
But tell him, ‚ÄúI believe it‚Äôs K-pop! Sounds like Stray Kids, but I‚Äôm not sure.‚Äù
He cuts me off with, ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs weird, right?‚Äù
My boss, strong as she is, was taken off guard.
And stood there struggling to construct a response.
They immediately gave out with a smart response.
I jumped in and looked at the man.
‚ÄúWell, I think it‚Äôs only weird if you think other cultures are weird!‚Äù
This man thought it was proper to respond, ‚ÄúI do.‚Äù
I looked him straight in the eye with a deadpan look.
And said, ‚ÄúWell, that‚Äôs weird.‚Äù
Now, their boss thinks they did the best thing.
Needless to say, he was now taken aback and couldn‚Äôt gather anything to say.
We took 1 book, and he didn‚Äôt say another word to us.
My boss thought it was the best thing I‚Äôve done at work, and I think I agree.
I hope he sits on that until he realizes how crappy an outlook that is.
Let‚Äôs find out what others have to say about this.
This person gives their honest opinion.

Here‚Äôs another personal thought.

This one is impressed.

People are loving the petty revenge.

And finally, this one can totally relate.

If you can‚Äôt say anything nice, just don‚Äôt say anything at all.
My mom said that.
If you liked that post, check this one about a guy who got revenge on his condo by making his own Christmas light rules.

title: Seventeen‚Äôs S.Coups Shares Behind the Scenes Looks at His First Met Gala With¬†Boss
description: The K-pop star offers a behind-the-scenes look as he prepared to head to the red carpet, wearing a custom Boss design inspired by a Korean hanbok jeogori jacket.
full_text:
On Monday, new Boss global ambassador S.Coups attended the Met Gala wearing a custom look inspired by a Korean hanbok jeogori jacket, with a matching gray wool flannel blazer with hanbok double-breasted collar and coordinating stand-collar shirt. The look was accessorized with gray wool heeled boots, and a Piaget diamond watch.




	‚ÄúWorking with S.Coups has been a very smooth process,‚Äù said Boss creative director Marco Falcioni of the brand‚Äôs first collaboration with the musician, who was named an ambassador late last month. ‚Ää




	‚ÄúThe conversation was very much about what does tailoring mean for S.Coups,‚Äù Falcioni said, adding that he aimed to create a tailored look that would resonate with both the brand‚Äôs DNA and S.Coups. The conversation quickly turned to the hanbok, and the team decided to design an outfit informed by the construction and proportions of the traditional Korean garment. ‚Äú‚ÄäWe were able to create something which was new to us [Boss], new for S.Coups, and resonated well for both.‚Äù

	









	Going into Monday‚Äôs Met Gala, S.Coups was looking forward to the moment he stepped out on the red carpet to debut the outfit. ‚ÄúI hope to be seen as an embodiment of Boss‚Äô captivating style and aesthetic,‚Äù said S.Coups. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm also excited to see all the amazing looks and how everyone will bring their own unique take to the event.‚Äù Here, the Seventeen leader reflects on beginning his journey as a Boss ambassador, and an upcoming milestone for the K-pop group and himself.




	WWD: Why were you excited to attend the Met Gala this year?¬†S.Coups: The Met Gala is such a significant night that brings fashion and art together, and it felt like a great chance to broaden my perspective. As a Boss ambassador, I was also eager to see the expertise and craftsmanship behind their suits firsthand.¬†




	WWD: What do you appreciate about your Boss look, and how is it setting the tone for the evening?¬†S.Coups: It‚Äôs a custom-tailored look inspired by jeogori, the Korean hanbok jacket, so it fits me perfectly and highlights a creative design ‚Äî like the contrasting shades of gray on the inside and outside of the coat that add a subtle allure when revealed with each step. It really sets the tone for this year‚Äôs Met, which celebrates ‚Äútailoring‚Äù as a form of self-expression and individuality.¬†




	WWD: What has been rewarding about working with Boss as their newest global brand ambassador?S.Coups: It‚Äôs truly an honor to start my journey with Boss at my first Met Gala, and I‚Äôm filled with excitement and anticipation to share even more exciting collaborations in the future.




	WWD: How would you describe your style offstage?S.Coups: I tend to prefer comfortable clothes. Since I often wear stage outfits and need to prepare for dance practices, I naturally gravitate toward more comfortable options.




	WWD: You guys [Seventeen] are getting ready to release your fifth album ‚ÄúHappy Burstday‚Äù later this month. What can fans look forward to with this new release and the summer ahead?S.Coups: We‚Äôre all pumped up and ready to give it our all for this album and performance. It feels like a grand way to close out my 20s. The album will be released on our 10th anniversary, May 26, so I hope you‚Äôll give it lots of love, and look forward to sharing the next 10 years with us.

title: ENHYPEN are ready for global superstardom
description: Fresh off a landmark Coachella performance, and with a global tour on the horizon, the award-winning K-pop group tell us why their new EP, DESIRE : UNLEASH, is their most important yet
full_text:
In April, ENHYPEN played Coachella with a set spanning the combative (‚ÄúFuture Perfect (Pass The MIC)‚Äù) to the ethereal (‚ÄúMoonstruck‚Äù). Fan favourites like ‚ÄúParadoXXX Invasion‚Äù and ‚ÄúBlockbuster‚Äù were rearranged into even chunkier beasts, the live band cranking up the tension. ‚ÄúDrunk-Dazed‚Äù became a pounding rave. The audience swelled for their second weekend, and amid the dust and whipping winds, Jungwon, Heeseung, Jay, Sunghoon, Jake, Sunoo and Ni-ki, whose records now regularly sell over a million copies, delivered an unspoken yet clear-cut message: ENHYPEN are ready for superstardom.¬†
Three days before this interview, Jay went live on the social platform Weverse. Self-aware and erudite, the 23-year-old sat in a small practice room, his beloved guitars behind him, and told Engenes (ENHYPEN‚Äôs fandom) that he believed 2025 and their new EP, DESIRE : UNLEASH, to be the most important of their career.¬†
The tipping point Jay‚Äôs referring to feels very real. Now in their fifth year, with an acclaimed Coachella set under their belts, a growing awards list, a US tour (their fourth) scheduled for August followed by European arena dates (their first), and their sixth EP in hand, their ambitions are palpable. ‚ÄúWe're going to be trying a lot of new things, performance-wise,‚Äù Jay tells Dazed over Zoom. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre showcasing a never-before-seen face of ENHYPEN.‚Äù



Prior to the EP‚Äôs release, there were glimpses of this new ENHYPEN via four conceptual shoots (MAKE, YOU, MINE, and ENGENE) and a concept cinema video that teased the record‚Äôs exploration of desire and ruin set within the band‚Äôs ongoing vampiric lore. Mentioning MAKE elicits little snorts of laughter from Jake, Jay, and the band‚Äôs leader, Jungwon. ‚ÄúI definitely thought it was very daring but it tied in very well with the overarching concept,‚Äù says Jay, with no pun intended. ‚ÄúIt brought something new to the table.‚Äù¬†
They‚Äôre aware that the fandom lost their collective minds upon seeing the members in leather shackles and shibari, their skin sprouting thorns and branded with phrases like ‚ÄòMonster In Me‚Äô and Make Mine‚Äô, a knife being licked, a hacksaw, mace, and chainsaw in hand. They saw the responses, from thirsty to surreal, on social media. ‚ÄúI did look at a lot of fan edits and one of them included me pulling a cow, which was very memorable,‚Äù says Jungwon, who, amused, ended up personally responding to the said bovine edit.
But, humour aside, DESIRE : UNLEASH is, Jake says, ‚Äúwhere we talk about loving someone but also wanting to destroy them. Ever since our debut EP, we‚Äôve talked about two opposite but connected things, and the times in life where you come across making a choice [between them]. When there‚Äôs good on one side, there‚Äôs bad [on the other], there‚Äôs evil and there‚Äôs happiness, and the topic of desire always changes when we put out an album. [This EP] might be a bit extreme, like, no one's gonna have the kind of desires that we talk about,‚Äù he says with a laugh. ‚ÄúBut it puts it at a level where it‚Äôs more interesting or appealing to listeners. And I think people can relate to it in a way. Everyone has desires within, and everyone goes through a time where they have to fight them.‚Äù¬†¬†


Courtesy of ENHYPEN

ENHYPEN‚Äôs overarching lore has always been most fascinating when you flip the vampiric story (trying not to fight the darkness, taming the desire for blood, and experiencing human love and loss, in a nutshell) and view it through the lens of fame: transitioning from the norm to an idol, decadence and temptation, the loss of control and battle to regain it, and the cost of an ever-present hunger for more.¬†
You might wonder if such a consuming and ever-expanding narrative has shaped, or in fact been reflective of, the band‚Äôs growing understanding of themselves as people and idols. But, explains Jungwon, this has come entirely independent of the world-building encircling them. ‚ÄúOur lore and us as artists are two separate things. When we‚Äôre onstage, we‚Äôre not focused on trying to explain our lore, we‚Äôre not consciously thinking of the Dark Moon universe, we‚Äôre performers and we just want to pull off that performance in the best way possible. The same goes for when we‚Äôre in the studio. The lore is an added excitement for the fans to have more fun with, and when we‚Äôre on stage we just focus on what we need to do best.‚Äù¬†
ENHYPEN will always be the first to admit they‚Äôre still learning and refining their craft. After wrapping up Coachella, Heeseung described their set as ‚Äúperfect‚Äù, which he‚Äôs now a little sheepish about. ‚ÄúLooking back, me saying that it was perfect was a kind of spur-of-the-moment thing because I was really hyped up,‚Äù he laughs. ‚ÄúThere are definitely some things we could have done better, but it was the most gratifying stage I‚Äôve done in my career. Coachella is going to be a new benchmark for us in putting together more impressive stages, not just for me but the entire group.‚Äù
Some days and some sessions are easier than others. Take ‚ÄúFlashover‚Äù, the new EP‚Äôs future bass banger, which was super straightforward to embody, says Sunoo: ‚ÄúIt blew me away when I first heard it. It‚Äôs really intense and it left a very strong impression as the first track.‚Äù¬†
Whereas the lead single ‚ÄúBad Desire (With or Without You)‚Äù presented a conundrum for Sunghoon: ‚ÄúIt was a little tricky to wrap my head around in terms of its substance and, in many ways, I was a bit stuck on how I should go about this song.‚Äù Getting unstuck was a case of ‚Äújust singing it again and again,‚Äù he adds, as his bandmates laugh. ‚ÄúWe tried a lot of different things, like adjusting the key and so forth and over the course of that, it came to me.‚Äù



One of the most in-demand groups in the business, last year alone they released their second studio album, ROMANCE : UNTOLD, its repackage (ROMANCE : UNTOLD - daydream -), an EP (Memorabilia), toured seven countries for five months with two different productions, attended a Prada show (for whom they‚Äôre ambassadors) in Milan, filmed their own YouTube variety show and countless brand and media shoots. Unable to spend weeks testing and tweaking material in the studio, they‚Äôve instead developed the ability to adapt and adopt, and be damn fast at it.
‚ÄúThese days we get recording done pretty quickly,‚Äù says Sunghoon.¬†
Adds Jungwon: ‚ÄúFor this particular title track, it really took a short amount of time. We only recorded two or three times, I think.‚Äù
So, hypothetically, ENHYPEN‚Äôs superpower at this point could be to knock out, say, a two-disc mega concept album in a day?¬†
‚ÄúOne [working] day is too much of a stretch. We‚Äôd take more than that,‚Äù says Sunoo, half-smiling, half in the realm of ‚Äòaw hell, no‚Äô .
Heeseung laughs: ‚ÄúMaybe if they caged us up and all we did for 24 hours straight was record? Maybe.‚Äù
There is an inherent genrelessness to K-pop, with albums running the entire gamut of popular music where synth-pop can sit next to a soft, treacly ballad, next to a smoky R&B jam. Done without care, it floats adrift on an identity crisis. ENHYPEN‚Äôs circumvented that risk with an infrastructure on their EPs ‚Äì an experimental intro, a decadent lead single and an equally extravagant, so-good-it-could-be-lead-single track, a mid-tempo singalong, a curveball, and a definitive closer ‚Äì which guides the listener from record to record and, for the band, creates a stable platform from which they can build out and play with sound.¬†
DESIRE : UNLEASH is no exception to this design ‚Äì ‚ÄúEach track is distinctive, each song has a different meaning and reason for why it‚Äôs there, which makes it even more exciting when we‚Äôre in the booth, so I hope you‚Äôll savour how they‚Äôre one of a kind,‚Äù says Heeseung ‚Äì even as it makes no bones about being their most grown-up record. Eight tracks over 17 minutes is short but in this time it‚Äôs dominant, pleading, lovesick, besotted, tormented, and unabashedly horny.¬†

We‚Äôve never done a real hip hop song. It might lead to a bigger spectrum of music for us, I think this is a starting point.
‚Äì Jake, ENHYPEN

During a recent US interview, Jay described the EP as ‚Äúshocking‚Äù. On the shuddering ‚ÄúBad Desire (With or Without You)‚Äù, melancholia entwines with basic instinct (‚ÄòA heaven without you must be like hell‚Ä¶ a hell where I embrace you must be like heaven‚Ä¶ Tell me all your deepest, all your bad desires‚Äô). ‚ÄúToo Close‚Äù softens its voracious appetite ‚Äì ‚ÄôAll the cravings I kept down, it feels like they‚Äôre awakening‚Äô ‚Äì with jazzy lounge piano, while the lyrics for ‚ÄúOutside‚Äù run thus: ‚ÄòWas a pretty boy but it‚Äôs getting ugly, The sounds of my desire hit me, like they‚Äôre breaking my head, No virtue signaling, just wanna have you, Angels and demons up all night‚Äô. Jungwon grins: ‚ÄúI think fans will be able to understand where Jay is coming from.‚Äù¬†
Let's pause on ‚ÄúOutside‚Äù for a moment. Sampling Three 6 Mafia‚Äôs ‚ÄúStay Fly‚Äù, it‚Äôs their first concerted foray into hip hop, a genre minimally explored by previous tracks ‚ÄúBlockbuster‚Äù, ‚ÄúFuture Perfect (Pass The MIC)‚Äù and ‚ÄúDaydream‚Äù. ENHYPEN ‚Äì who are somewhat sleepy because it‚Äôs morning and they‚Äôre in the thick of the hectic final dash to release day ‚Äì perk up. Jake, fuelled on iced cornsilk tea and snacks, describes ‚ÄúOutside‚Äù as ‚Äôinteresting and charismatic‚Äô. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve never done something like this before, a real hip hop song,‚Äù he explains. ‚ÄúWe have a session where we all listen to the songs, we talk about what we want to put on the album and as soon as we heard this, we knew it suited the whole colour of this album. It might lead to a bigger spectrum of music for us, and I think this is a starting point.‚Äù


Courtesy of ENHYPEN

Ownership of their work increasingly stretches beyond being merely performers. Previously, Ni-ki has contributed choreography, all the band has penned lyrics, and Heeseung co-wrote and co-produced ‚ÄúHighway 1009‚Äù for their last album. On DESIRE : UNLEASH, it‚Äôs Jay‚Äôs debut as a songwriter/producer, teaming up with FRANTS who worked on last year‚Äôs countrified EDM banger, ‚ÄúTeeth‚Äù (unarguably one of their finest deep cuts). Jay‚Äôs ‚ÄúHelium‚Äù shares its galloping, urgent cadence but leans in one of his great loves ‚Äì rock music ‚Äì with guitar (which he, too, played) squalling across its back half, tag-teaming with Heeseung‚Äôs soaring ad-libs.
‚ÄúFRANTS is a person I feel very comfortable around so we‚Äôve been working on a few songs together,‚Äù says Jay, who adds that his starting point is simple ‚Äúcuriosity‚Äù around a certain sound and ‚Äúmy desire to have more of those [types of] songs. ‚ÄúWhen I thought about helium I thought not about lightness but how a balloon full of helium will fly really high into the atmosphere, and I decided to liken that to a person‚Äôs love towards me, which really lifts me up to that high place.‚Äù
No ENHYPEN record would be complete without the inclusion of their numerous lyrical and visual motifs ‚Äì the moon, monsters, fate, blood, binding, and lines, to name but a few ‚Äì offering a meticulous, satisfying exercise in connecting the dots past and present. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been working on this lore since debut and I‚Äôm fascinated by finding tiny things that tie in with our older concepts and overarching themes. A lot of attention goes into our videos and album props, the little pieces here and there that allow Engene to make their own interpretations and enjoy it in every way,‚Äù says Ni-ki, flagging, as an example, his custom fang grillz in their new video, where he bites his second self in a scene reminiscent of a previous ENHYPEN choreography. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm impressed how our [record] company doesn't try to keep us in a comfort zone but stretches the theme in different ways.‚Äù
But, as is the way with any new release, ENHYPEN find themselves facing that wily, unpredictable path towards the future. And with a title like DESIRE : UNLEASH, there‚Äôs only one thing left to ask‚Ä¶ What is it they desire next?¬†
‚ÄúI definitely have desires for ENHYPEN to reach new heights, and my personal dreams into which I try to channel positive energy so all this can be a stepping stone for a big leap forward,‚Äù says Sunghoon. He ponders the contents of those dreams under his breath for a long moment, then laughs at himself for overthinking his reply. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm talking about me becoming a better person who goes further as a human being.‚Äù
‚ÄúI try not to read into it too much, I just want to be a cooler artist with a lot of energy and potential, and to create more music packed with emotions that a wider audience can relate to,‚Äù adds Heeseung.¬†
As for Jake, the soft-spoken, Australia-raised member of the group, he offers up a wide, easy-going grin. ‚ÄúDesire doesn't have to be extreme, so mine would be just meeting our fans all over the world more often, and having a really, really great time.‚Äù
DESIRE : UNLEASH¬†is out today (June 5)

title: Big Ocean breaks new ground as K-pop‚Äôs first deaf group
description: Big Ocean, the world‚Äôs first K-pop group composed entirely of deaf and hard-of-hearing artists, is breaking barriers with high-tech tools and inclusive performances
full_text: Big Ocean, a three-member K-pop group composed entirely of artists with hearing disabilities, is redefining the limits of music and performance ‚Äî one beat at a time.When Big Ocean takes the stage, they seamlessly incorporate sign language into their performances. But their polished shows are built on extensive preparation using high-tech tools born from necessity ‚Äî vibrating smartwatches that pulse with musical beats and LED visual metronomes that flash timing cues during practice sessions. This technological approach represents significant progress in South Korea‚Äôs entertainment industry, where career opportunities for people with disabilities have historically been limited.The trio, PJ, Jiseok and Chanyeon, made their debut in April 2024 and recently wrapped a solo European tour marking their first anniversary. The band performed in four countries, including France and the U.K., while promoting their second mini-album, ‚ÄúUnderwater,‚Äù which dropped on April 20.PJ rose to prominence as a YouTuber who educated viewers about hearing disabilities. Chanyeon previously worked as an audiologist. Jiseok was a professional ski racer.To achieve the precision crucial in K-pop‚Äôs demanding choreography and music, Big Ocean relies on technologies rarely seen in the genre. Members wear modified vibrating smartwatches that deliver rhythmic cues to their wrists and practice with visual metronomes ‚Äî flashing light guides displayed on monitors ‚Äî to help stay in sync when audio alone isn‚Äôt enough.Chanyeon uses a hybrid hearing device with Bluetooth that streams music directly from mobile devices. The group also uses a pitch-checking app and AI voice conversion technology to support vocal training and enhance audio output after recordings.Dancing to visual cues ‚ÄúWe each felt rhythm differently when dancing,‚Äù PJ told The Associated Press. ‚ÄúSo when we‚Äôd play the same song and dance in front of the mirror, one of us would move faster while another would move slower. To solve this timing issue, we decided to memorize everything together and create our own cues with each other.‚ÄùThis precision becomes critical during live performances, where unexpected disruptions can derail even experienced performers. ‚ÄúWhen we performed in France, our fans were cheering so loudly we lost the beat,‚Äù said Jiseok. ‚ÄúBut we looked at each other and quickly handled the situation ‚Äî just like we practiced.‚ÄùStage effects and certain musical styles create additional obstacles. ‚ÄúWhen a lot of smoke comes up, sometimes we momentarily can‚Äôt see the stage movements in front of us,‚Äù PJ said. ‚ÄúOur concentration gets disrupted instantly in those moments.‚Äù‚ÄúWhen there‚Äôs no clear beat in a song, it‚Äôs really hard for us to stay synchronized,‚Äù Jiseok said. ‚ÄúWhen the bass is overwhelming, it‚Äôs difficult for us to catch it accurately.‚ÄùPromoting accessibility Despite these challenges, Big Ocean‚Äôs commitment to accessibility and inclusion has inspired their global fanbase. Big Ocean‚Äôs global fanbase ‚Äî known as PADO ‚Äî has responded with similar commitment.‚ÄúWhile communicating with PADO, we‚Äôve heard that they‚Äôre actually learning Korean sign language for us, or learning various sign languages to communicate with us,‚Äù Jiseok said. ‚ÄúWhen we see how much they‚Äôre preparing and putting in that effort, we feel so grateful.‚ÄùThe group uses English for basic communication with international fans and incorporates Korean Sign Language, American Sign Language and International Sign to promote accessibility and inclusion.Jiseok credits BTS‚Äôs RM with inspiring his musical journey. He said RM‚Äôs donation to his former school ‚Äî a private institution for deaf and hard of hearing students ‚Äî gave him access to music and dance for the first time. ‚ÄúWithout those learning opportunities, I probably never would have dreamed of becoming a K-pop idol,‚Äù he said.Fostering collaboration Looking ahead, Big Ocean hopes to build on its growing global profile.‚ÄúWe recently saw Justin Bieber‚Äôs Instagram post asking for music collaborators, so we sent him a DM,‚Äù PJ said. ‚ÄúAll of us would love the opportunity to work with him. And personally, I‚Äôd also love to work with Billie Eilish.‚ÄùAs the band reflects on its first year, Chanyeon said their biggest growth has been internal.‚ÄúI‚Äôve always liked playing it safe ‚Äî even with food, I only ate what I was used to,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut through Big Ocean, I‚Äôve gained confidence in trying new things. That‚Äôs what I‚Äôm most satisfied with.‚Äù
